ref: 11122 lṓkatē ʻ sees ʼ Dhātup. (lulōkē Bhaṭṭ). 2. lōkáyati ʻ shines ʼ Dhātup. (ʻ sees ʼ R.) [Cf. lṓcatē ʻ sees ʼ, lōcáyati ʻ shines ʼ Dhātup. which could also be source of MIA. and NIA. words below: but forms with lōk -- (esp. cmpds.) are much more widely attested in literature than those with lōc -- . -- √lōk, √*luc]
